definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: It is said that time is fleeting, it passes like this.
sentences.chinese: 是說時間如白駒過隙，逝者如斯。

sentences.english: It passes on just like this, not ceasing day or night!
He also noted the practice of burning fake money to honor the dead, a custom still alive in China.
sentences.chinese: 他在書裏也寫到了這種給逝者燒紙錢的習慣。

sentences.english: Funerals should not only serve to memorialize the dead, but also to give hope to those they`ve left behind.
sentences.chinese: 葬禮不該僅僅是爲了追念逝者，還要給予生者希望。

sentences.english: Helping them would be the best tribute to their sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 幫助他們將是對逝者的最好告慰。

sentences.english: Of course, nothing will bring back those loved ones that families have lost to terror.
sentences.chinese: 當然，對於恐怖襲擊的受害者家庭來說，逝者已矣。

sentences.english: For making peace with the deceased, one can also share merits for their well-being.
sentences.chinese: 與逝者和解的人也可以分享其福祉功德。

sentences.english: Maybe, maybe I understand that lost time is never.
sentences.chinese: 也許，也許我已明白，逝者如斯。

sentences.english: Time Passes Quickly, around the clock, time Rusuo, life is hard and short.
sentences.chinese: 逝者如斯，不捨晝夜，時光如梭，人生苦短。

sentences.english: The blood of those who fell cannot be wasted.

definition: to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
to rest/to go to sleep/to rest in peace/(history) Parthia
victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)
